title: 9.2.1 Multi-account scanning support
body:
## Parent Epic
Part of Epic 9: Advanced Security Scanning (#127)

## Objective
Enable Cloud Optimizer to scan multiple AWS accounts simultaneously with centralized result aggregation and account relationship management.

## Requirements
- Support scanning multiple AWS accounts from single control plane
- Manage account credentials and access methods
- Aggregate scan results across all accounts
- Track account metadata (account ID, name, environment, business unit)
- Support different authentication methods per account
- Handle account-level errors gracefully without failing entire scan
- Provide account-level result filtering and reporting
- Support scheduling scans for different accounts
- Track scan history and compliance posture per account

## Features to Implement
- Account registry for managing multiple accounts
- Credential management (IAM roles, access keys, assume role)
- Multi-threaded/async scanning for performance
- Result aggregation with account context
- Account grouping (by environment, business unit, etc.)
- Centralized dashboard showing all accounts
- Account-level compliance scoring
- Differential scanning (detect changes between scans)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Account registry database schema implemented
- [ ] API endpoints for account management (add, update, delete, list)
- [ ] Multi-account scanner orchestrator implemented
- [ ] Concurrent scanning with configurable thread pool
- [ ] Results properly tagged with account context
- [ ] Dashboard shows all accounts with summary statistics
- [ ] Account-level filtering in UI and API
- [ ] Error handling prevents cascade failures
- [ ] Unit tests cover account management (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration test validates multi-account scanning
- [ ] Documentation for account setup and management
- [ ] Scanner performance: 10+ accounts in parallel

## Technical Approach
- Database schema: accounts table with credentials and metadata
- Use boto3 STS for assume role authentication
- Implement ThreadPoolExecutor or asyncio for concurrent scanning
- Result schema includes account_id as required field
- Centralized error handling and retry logic
- UI: Account selector/filter component

## Estimated Effort
24-28 hours

## Dependencies
- Database schema migration
- AWS STS API access
- Cross-account IAM roles (setup documentation)
- Updated result aggregation logic
